result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby J Shelby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with ES with the exception of court proceedings. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Bobby J Shelby in court with attorney Patrick K Ritter.  Defendant Bobby J Shelby in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Patrick Ritter
Preliminary hearing at 11-25-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, ES.  No contact w/ 711 Kewanee Street Racine WI.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
